sections.skills: microsoft excel, outlook, powerpoint, word.â excellent communication skills organisational skills spss data entry researches autosuggestion as a mediator in weight management in female college students. master's thesis. (m.sc, 2014-15)â sample: 82 female college students, convenient sampling method. the selection of the 82 participants were based on the inclusion and exclusion criteria. the participants selected were assessed for their anthropometric data and they also completed who (five) well- being index. group a (exercise diet autosuggestion) and group b ( exercise diet ). results: a marginal but not a statistically significant difference in the body weight of the participants in both group a and group b. there was a statistically significant difference in the well-being of the participants in both group a and group b.â mindfulness and burnout of teachers in stateboard and matriculation schools (demographic factors). master's project. (m.sc, 2014) sample: 150 (51 female and 24 male in state board)(58 female and 17 male in matriculation) scales : mindfulness attention awareness scale and burnout inventory. the data were analysed by standard statistical tools such as karl pearson co- efficient of correlation, analysis of variance and t-test. result: there were no statistically significant relationship between mindfulness and burnout in both matriculation and state board schools.â relation between indian zodiac and personality types(mbti). master's project. (m.sc, 2015) sample: 100 samples (female 52 & male 48) , were randomly selected. the myers briggs type indicator (mbti) was administered and scored. the results showed that there was no significant relation between the two variables. the sample size cannot determine the relationship, further studies can be done to conclude or disprove the findings of the current study.â
